item.title: Common Programming Paradigms Overview
item.description: Why do we care about programming paradigms? The answer is they help us to align with architectural concerns like boundaries, location and accessing data and algorithm foundation in the modules. Programming paradigms are ways of programming that are reflected in language features. They tell us which structures to use and when to use them. There are 3 such main paradigms: structured programming object-orient programming functional programming. Most languages are multi-paradigm but levels of restrictions/enforcing can be different.
